page.title: 01Area Summary:N.& O.Silton
page.content: This area is principally farmland rising to forest and moorland in the North West.There are two settlements; Nether Silton and Over Silton which are small hamlets with populations of approximately 56 and 67 respectively. Very little recent building has taken place in Nether Silton where as Over Silton has been developed with relatively large new houses.The farmland all lies below 200 metres and is scattered with mixed family-run farms.The forest area is uninhabited and planted mainly with coniferous softwoods.It is run by the Forestry Commission.The area is flanked to the West by the A19 trunk road which provides easy access to Teesside to the North and York to the South.This is a major factor in attracting people to the area-they can live in the country yet easily reach the towns.
